image.altText: Peter Marshall wears a yellow firefighters jacket and stands in a crowd, addressing firefighters.

props.synopsis: Victoria's anti-corruption commission has found information was improperly fed from inside the state's former fire authority to the powerful United Firefighters Union.

title.children: IBAC report finds Metropolitan Fire Brigade employees improperly accessed executive emails to help union

image.altText: Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto, pictured outside the Federal Court in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal Party leader John Pesutto admits under cross-examination that he shared names with Jeff Kennett of party members who supported expelled MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: Pesutto shared defamation case settlement details with former Liberal premier Jeff Kennett, trial hears

image.altText: A photo of missing woman Samantha Murphy in a formal floral dress.

props.synopsis: Specialist teams have searched an area riddled with undocumented mines, just kilometres from where Ms Murphy's mobile phone was found in May.

title.children: Police revisit previously searched areas in hunt for missing woman Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A police officer wearing a dark uniform and yellow vest stands beside police tape and a sign saying "Welcome to The Grove."

props.synopsis: A teen accused of stabbing another boy to death at a Melbourne shopping centre did not apply for bail as he faced court for the first time.

title.children: Teen charged with 16yo boy's stabbing murder wipes tears away at court appearance

image.altText: Patrick Cripps kisses the Brownlow Medal on stage

props.synopsis: The existing record for most votes in a single season was broken twice in this year's Brownlow Medal count, but AFL CEO Andrew Dillon remains confident in the umpires' ability to read the game.

title.children: 'We trust our umpires implicitly': AFL resists Brownlow Medal voting overhaul despite record-breaking Cripps haul

image.altText: Carl Ditterich leaving court

props.synopsis: Carl Ditterich is facing court accused of sexually assaulting a teenage girl in 1985, when he was aged 39. He denies the allegations,

title.children: Teenager's diary entry referencing former AFL great could be key evidence in sexual assault trial

image.altText: An elaborate Chinese dragon in bright colours being paraded on a street, a few dragon carriers visible around it

props.synopsis: Two of Bendigo's Golden Dragons were vandalised earlier this year. In the wake of the heartbreak, we tell the remarkable story of how the third dragon came to be.

title.children: How lions, vandalism and Richard Branson led to the world's largest Golden Dragon in regional Victoria

image.altText: GettyImages-2174293749

props.synopsis: The Geelong Cats have a history of going all out with their costumes for their end-of-season party, and this year's effort is no different.

title.children: Geelong is renowned for its end-of-season costumes, but some of them this year require an explanation

image.altText: A large seal in water on its back yawning

props.synopsis: Sammy the elephant seal weighs thousands of kilograms and normally lives near Antarctica. But Portland locals have embraced him, while avoiding some of the trouble Tasmanians have experienced with another of his kind.

title.children: Victorian town falls in love with Sammy the four-tonne elephant seal

image.altText: James Lindesay and Joyce Schirrman sit on arm chairs wearing Sydney Swans scarfs.

props.synopsis: Ninety years ago, James Vane Lindesay was heading to watch South Melbourne play on the banks of Melbourne's Albert Park Lake. This Saturday, he and his sister will be praying for a premiership.

title.children: The last time the Swans and the Lions played in a footy grand final was in 1899. This weekend, they face off again

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: That huge slowdown in the pace of headline inflation was expected, but economists say it needs to be interpreted cautiously.

title.children: Headline inflation drops to 2.7pc, down from 3.5pc, as energy rebates kick in

image.altText: Flashes of light in a row in the sky coming out of the ground

props.synopsis: Hezbollah said on Wednesday that it had fired a ballistic missile targeting Israeli spy agency Mossad's headquarters near Tel Aviv, marking its first ballistic missile strike claim during the nearly year-long conflict.

title.children: Hezbollah launches its first ballistic missile strike in year-long conflict

image.altText: A hand holding a phone

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says there is no tsunami headed to Australia after sending a false warning to half the country earlier today.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology says no tsunami headed for Australia after sending false watch warning

image.altText: A weather map of Australia showing temperature changes for the week

props.synopsis: While parts of Australia's east coast are forecast for warm weather, a cold polar air mass is expected to bring rain and temperature declines of up to 20 degrees Celsius across the continent's south-east before the end of the week.

title.children: Icy change to bring 24-hour temperature drop of up to 20C as widespread rain soaks Australia

image.altText: Two boys

props.synopsis: Russell and Ben Smith were found dead in their Faulconbridge home earlier this month. Their mother has since been charged with two counts of domestic violence-related murder.

title.children: 'An absolute privilege to be your father': Hundreds gather to farewell boys allegedly murdered by their mother

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses speaks in front of a media wall that says "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Figures released on Wednesday are likely to show inflation is extraordinarily low. They will only add to the pressure on the Reserve Bank governor to cut rates.

title.children: The RBA governor has defended not cutting rates. But there's a problem with what she said

image.altText: Joe Daniher celebrates a goal as Nick Blakey looks on

props.synopsis: Joe Daniher will have a major say on whether Brisbane can claim its first premiership since 2004 when he lines up in the grand final on Saturday. It is a role he came very close to playing for the Lions's grand final opponents, Sydney.

title.children: How Brisbane's potential grand final gamebreaker Joe Daniher slipped out of Sydney's grasp twice

image.altText: Punnets of  red Perfection Fresh brand tomatoes on a supermarket shelf

props.synopsis: The company is one of three businesses hit by tomato brown rugose fruit virus in South Australia — the first time the virus has been detected in Australia.

title.children: Perfection Fresh to cut 'significant' number of jobs amid tomato virus outbreak

image.altText: Two women hugging and smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Mum Renea Johnson wants to give others the shopping experience that her trans daughter didn't have. So she opened an inclusive clothing store in regional Victoria.

title.children: A judgement-free place to find clothes true to you

image.altText: Will Ashcroft and Kai Lohmann hug after a goal is scored for the Lions

props.synopsis: A long-standing ovation is given to Sydney and Geelong for their masterful recruiting and player development, but Brisbane has produced a post-COVID scouting masterclass which could deliver their first premiership in 21 years.

title.children: Brisbane's post-COVID masterclass puts them on the brink of premiership glory

image.altText: Man with grey hair and glasses, standing in front of a wall full of old photographs

props.synopsis: Richard "Dick" Caine was charged with 39 offences committed against six teenagers at the pool and in his home and car in the 1970s and '80s. A court previously heard he had terminal lung and throat cancer and was expected to have only months to live.

title.children: Sydney swim coach dies weeks after being found guilty of raping and sexually assaulting young girls

image.altText: A crowd of out-of-focus people walk in front of a large in-focus Coles supermarket sign.

props.synopsis: You can't have missed the parade of political figures this year lining up to take a kick at the nation's biggest supermarket chains, Coles and Woolworths, who jointly control about 65 per cent of the grocery market.

title.children: It's a good ol' fashioned game of 'stacks on' for Coles and Woolworths

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in courtyard

props.synopsis: The prime minister declined to rebuff suggestions he planned to revisit the policy ahead of the election and said he would be comfortable with the public service examining proposals.

title.children: Albanese leaves the door open to Labor revisiting negative gearing, declining to rule out changes

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: A South Australian man who allegedly inflicted injuries to the baby boy in July has been arrested today and charged with manslaughter.

title.children: Man to face court over death of seven-week-old baby

image.altText: Portraits of nine women looking serious are arranged in a grid.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian women who won a landmark class action settlement more than a year ago over damage done by pelvic mesh have still not received any compensation.

title.children: More than a year after their $300 million settlement, these women have still not received any money

image.altText: Joe Biden stands in front of a green wall and holds up a hand.

props.synopsis: World leaders are gathering in New York this week with a growing list of conflicts and crises to discuss. Here are some takeaways from the first day of debate at the UN General Assembly.

title.children: Warned of a 'powder keg that risks engulfing the world', global leaders gather at the UN

image.altText: A court sketch of Ryan W. Routh, suspected of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The US Department of Justice has charged Ryan Routh, the suspected gunman who staked out Donald Trump at Florida golf course, with attempting an assassination.

title.children: Ryan Routh charged with attempted assassination of Trump

image.altText: Elham is hugging her two daughters. She is wearing a white hijab.

props.synopsis: Australia's Lebanese community is mourning family members killed by Israeli air strikes in southern Lebanon.

title.children: 'Why the children?': Lebanese Australian community heartbroken and angry over Israel's attack

image.altText: Fatman Scoop

props.synopsis: DJ and rapper FatMan Scoop died of "hypertensive and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease", the Connecticut Office of the Chief Medical Examiner has confirmed.

title.children: FatMan Scoop's cause of death revealed a month after rapper's onstage collapse

image.altText: A dead cattle's skull resting against a tree, rusty lighting

props.synopsis: Allegations of animal welfare issues and financial mismanagement have plagued the Kimberley Meat Company for nearly a decade. Now it has shut down owing $103 million.

title.children: 'Appalling': Local businesses out of pocket after abattoir shuts down owing $103 million

image.altText: Sri Lankan Tamil woman Cammy Joseph sitting at a table

props.synopsis: The island nation's new president Anura Dissanayake heralded a "new era of renaissance" as he was sworn in on Monday. Here is how the Sri Lankan diaspora are responding.

title.children: Some Sri Lankans say their new left-wing president is 'a clean guy', but others have mixed feelings

image.altText: A woman holding a young child.

props.synopsis: Medicare is now covering just over half of specialist fees, forcing Australians to increasingly dip into their own pockets and delay vital care.

title.children: Experts warn Medicare rebates for specialists 'almost meaningless'

image.altText: A shot of downtown Whitesburg shows red brick buildings and cars lining a street

props.synopsis: A small US town has been rocked after a district court judge was shot and killed in his chambers. A sheriff and long-time colleague has been charged with his murder.

title.children: The case of a sheriff accused of murdering a judge in his chambers is captivating Americans

image.altText: An electric vehicle by Geely is seen displayed at a car showroom.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it is in contact with the US about the new moves it has put up against Chinese car companies.

title.children: The US government is effectively banning Chinese-made cars from its roads. Some in Australia want the government to take notice

image.altText: Suzanne Armstrong and Susan Bartlett were housemates in Collingwood in 1977.

props.synopsis: Over the weekend Perry Kouroumblis was arrested in Rome in connection to the 1977 Easey Street murders. It was news that left his friend Phil Akers 'dumbfounded'.

title.children: 'Don't think he's capable of murder': Friend shocked by Perry Kouroumblis's arrest over Easey Street murders
